name.namePart: Printed in New York by George Miller

mods.abstract: This work belongs to Ms. Durieux's "North American Series" and was. The work was drawn with a lithographic pencil. Line dominates the composition creating the scene with an economy of tone. The satire is seen in the artist's contrasting the two female swimmers, allowing their faces and setting to suggest that which the title states: FISH.
mods.note: This is a lithograph printed from a zinc plate.

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). Museum of Art
